definition: to sb's face/in sb's presence
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: A true friend stabs you in the front.
sentences.chinese: 真朋儕纔會當面中傷定位。

sentences.english: Or she might avoid going to the doctor to avoid confirmation of her fears.
sentences.chinese: 或許她可能會躲着醫生，以避免當面確認她的恐懼。

sentences.english: Please Check Your Change and Ticket.
They praised him to his face.
I went over there, no punches, no shoves to the face, just confrontation.
sentences.chinese: 我走過去，沒有動手，我只是想跟他作個當面對質。

sentences.english: The Soviet 36th Motorized Rifle Division and 5th Machine Gun Brigade opposed these forces.
sentences.chinese: 當面之敵爲蘇軍第36摩步師和第5機槍旅。

sentences.english: I handed the book to him personally.
True friends stab you in the front.
You can also pay by cash, you will get a receipt from us.
sentences.chinese: 您還可以當面付款，本所給您開據收據作爲憑證。

sentences.english: Puccini meets a young journalist who questions him and directs him towards the original sources of his vocation.
sentences.chinese: 一位年輕的記者當面質問了普契尼的創作靈感的來源。

sentences.english: I want him to identify him enemy Tong Pak Fu.
sentences.chinese: 讓他當面認一下，他不共戴天的仇人唐伯虎。

sentences.english: But he regretted the pleasantry; it was too near a satire.
sentences.chinese: 後來一想，這句笑話太象當面挖苦了，他又後悔起來。

sentences.english: She threw the lie in his face.
When facing north, right to left.
sentences.chinese: 當面朝北坐時，從右到左排。

sentences.english: ChengYi aware of the true nature of the event, then alone to find confronted everlasting light.
sentences.chinese: 承義察覺到事件的真相後，便獨自找永光當面對質。

sentences.english: Interested parties may contact the message after about face to face in Beijing to see the goods.
sentences.chinese: 有意者可短信聯繫後約在北京當面看貨。

definition: to refuse/to decline/to reject
counterpart/other person involved/opposite side/other side/receiving party
to take the initiative/to do sth of one's own accord/spontaneous/active/opposite: passive 被動|被动[bei4 dong4]/drive (of gears and shafts etc)
unwilling/unwillingness
to set about (a task)/to hit/to punch/to touch
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
actual situation/truth
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
relation/relationship/to concern/to affect/to have to do with/guanxi/CL:個|个[ge4]
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
persons involved or implicated/party (to an affair)
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
to make a telephone call
to drop in/to visit/to lock a door/(of a shop) to close/to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family
